revisions.*: Because "rvslots" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used.

{{Taxobox | image = Agaricus californicus 2.jpg | image_width = 234px | image_caption = | regnum = [[Fungi]] | divisio = [[Basidiomycota]] | classis = [[Agaricomycetes]] | ordo = [[Agaricales]] | familia = [[Agaricaceae]] | genus = ''[[Agaricus]]'' | species = '''''A. californicus''''' | binomial = ''Agaricus californicus'' | binomial_authority = [[Charles Horton Peck|Peck]] (1895) }} {{mycomorphbox | name = ''Agaricus californicus'' | whichGills = free | capShape = convex | hymeniumType = gills | stipeCharacter = ring | sporePrintColor = brown | howEdible = poisonous }} '''''Agaricus californicus''''', commonly known as the '''California Agaricus''', is a poisonous mushroom in the [[section (biology)|section]] ''Xanthodermati'' of the genus ''[[Agaricus]]''. It is mildly [[poisonous mushroom|poisonous]], causing gastrointestinal upset in many individuals. The [[etiology]] of these symptoms is unclear and some individuals can eat it without experiencing symptoms, but since there is no way to tell who can eat the mushroom safely it is generally recommended against. ==Differentiating ''A. californicus''== ''Agaricus californicus'' is similar in general appearance to many other ''Agaricus'' species, especially to [[Agaricus campestris|''A. campestris'']], [[Agaricus cupreobrunneus|''A. cupreobrunneus'']], and [[Agaricus bisporus|''A. bisporus'']], which are commonly collected for the table. Since ''A. californicus'' is toxic, differentiating it from other similar mushrooms is important. ''Agaricus californicus'' – like many other ''Agaricus'' species of the section ''Xanthodermati'' – displays a yellowing reaction where its [[trama (mycology)|flesh]] has been damaged. Unlike ''[[Agaricus xanthodermus|A. xanthodermus]]'' (a close relative in the section ''Xanthodermati'',) ''A. californicus''{{'}}s yellowing reaction is not always readily apparent. Even in specimens where the reaction is not immediately apparent the addition of a basic solution such as [[sodium hydroxide|NaOH]] or even Lysol will cause the reaction to become quite noticeable, making this a convenient way to distinguish between ''A. californicus'' and similar mushrooms. ==See also== *[[List of Agaricus species|List of ''Agaricus'' species]] ==References== {{Reflist|refs= {{cite web|url=http://www.mykoweb.com/CAF/species/Agaricus_californicus.html|title=California Fungi—Agaricus californicus|accessdate=2010-07-27|publisher=MykoWeb}} Arora D. 1986. Mushrooms Demystified: A Comprehensive Guide to the Fleshy Fungi (2nd edition). Berkeley: Ten Speed Press. {{ISBN|0-89815-169-4}}. }} ==External links== {{IndexFungorum|220273}}
